reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports three months from the date of the adoption of this resolution
summary:
* Welcomes the signing of a protocol to strengthen the Moscow agreement on ceasefire and separation of forces (para 12).
* Calls on parties to take concrete steps to revitalize the peace process, including work in the Coordinating Council (para 13).
* Welcomes positive developments on reopening railways and return of refugees and internally displaced persons (para 14).
* Notes the importance of civil society contacts in building mutual confidence (para 15).
* Stresses the urgent need for progress on refugees and internally displaced persons, and calls on parties to facilitate returns (para 16).
* Calls for rapid finalization of a letter of intent on returns and welcomes meetings on refugees and internally displaced persons (para 17).
* Reaffirms the inalienable rights of refugees and internally displaced persons to return to their homes (para 18).
* Recalls the Abkhaz side's responsibility to protect returnees and facilitate returns (para 19).
* Welcomes UNDP activities in the Gali, Ochamchira, and Tkvarcheli districts (para 20).
* Urges parties to implement recommendations on the Gali sector (para 21).
* Calls on the Abkhaz side to allow swift deployment of the police component in the Gali sector (para 22).
* Calls on the Abkhaz side to improve law enforcement protection and address lack of instruction in mother tongue for the ethnic Georgian population (para 23).
* Welcomes measures taken by the Georgian side to end activities of illegal armed groups (para 24).
* Condemns violations of the Moscow Agreement and welcomes relative calm in the Kodori valley (para 25-26).
* Urges parties to abide by security protocols and cooperate to improve security (para 27).
* Reiterates its call on the Georgian side to provide security guarantees for monitoring in the upper Kodori valley (para 28).
* Underlines the primary responsibility of both sides to provide security for UNOMIG and other international personnel (para 29).
* Strongly condemns abductions of personnel and calls on parties to take action (para 30).
* Calls on parties to identify those responsible for the shooting down of a UNOMIG helicopter (para 31).
* Welcomes efforts to implement the Secretary-General's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse (para 32).
* Decides to extend the mandate of UNOMIG until 31 January 2006 (para 33).
